definition: brief and to the point (idiom)/succinct
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to grip forcefully/to clutch at/to guard/to control/to hold
variant of 扼[e4]
to demand/to request/to coerce
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if

sentences.english: The news reports of journalists of radio and TV station need to be concise.
sentences.chinese: 电台和电视台的记者的新闻报道必须简明扼要。

sentences.english: Keep all things short and to the point.
This problem was capsulized in his letter.
sentences.chinese: 在他的信中简明扼要地提到这个问题。

sentences.english: In general, the presentation must be to-the-point and concise.
sentences.chinese: 一般而言，表达应当简明扼要。

sentences.english: Just as it's a good thing to keep program definitions short and to the point, tables should be short.
sentences.chinese: 与保持程序定义简明扼要相同，表也应该保持简短。

sentences.english: As threats go, It was concise and to the point.
sentences.chinese: 这是封恐吓信，信的内容简明扼要。

sentences.english: This book provides a clear and concise introduction to the philosophy of Gilles Deleuze.
sentences.chinese: 这本书提供了一个向德勒兹哲学作了简明扼要的介绍。

sentences.english: Please say it clearly and simply.
sentences.chinese: 请简明扼要地说清你的意思。

sentences.english: The explanation in this dictionary is concise and to the point.
sentences.chinese: 这部词典里的释义简明扼要。

sentences.english: In this concise, crisply readable book, Professor D.
sentences.chinese: 在这本简明扼要，清晰易读的书里，D。

definition: concise and comprehensive (idiom)
simple/brief
simple and clear/concise
brief (statement, summary etc)/briefly/brevity
concise/brief
thorough and detailed/exhaustive/the tedious details in full
to repeat (one's own words or sb else's)/(in the classroom) to paraphrase what one has learned
variant of 複述|复述[fu4 shu4]
to concentrate on the main points (idiom); to bring out the essentials
terse/succinct
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
to expound (a position)/to elaborate (on a topic)/to treat (a subject)
to relate (a story or information)/to tell or talk about/to recount/narration/telling/narrative/account
(of a text) very lengthy (idiom)
an assertion/to declare/to state
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to state/to assert
